In the layout classes, only set the Group layoutTarget's scrollRect
when a scrolling request is implied, i.e. when
vertical,horizontalScrollPosition isn't zero, or when the Group's
contentWidth,Height is bigger than its unscaled width,height.
At the moment, the code for doing this is a static function on BasicLayout
that's also used by Vertical,HorizontalLayout.  If a layout utilities
class was defined, BasicLayout.setScrollRect() should move there.
This change should mitigate the number of bugs caused by
unconditionally clipping Groups to their width,height.  Unfortunately,
because of line stroke widths and anti-aliasing, many skins
currently draw outside of their measured bounds.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Most of the rest of the "Group as Viewport" feature.  Enables simple
scrolling for Groups with VerticalLayout or HorizontalLayout, including
support for fixed size rows/columns.  Currently, if variableSizeRows/Columns
is true, then rowHeight/columnWidth must be specified.
Replaced private static GAP:int constant with a similar "gap"
property.  Gap is the vertical space between rows, default is 6.
Added a columnCount:int property and a protected explicitColumnCount var.
The columnCount property specifies the number of visible columns, which
implies the layoutTarget's width.  The default is -1 which means
that all columns should be visible.
If the variableColumnWidth is true, HorzontalLayout works as
in earlier versions.  Otherwise the contentWidth and measuredWidth
Changed the updateDisplayList function to set the scrollRect
VerticalLayout.  Setting the width of a VerticalLayout
has the same effect as setting colWidth would have.

Eliminated some Java-style bracket formatting atrocities.

Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Partial commit of the "Group as Viewport" feature.  Enables
simple scrolling for Groups with VerticalLayout.
They're default 0 and they're mapped to the origin of the Group's
scrollRect.  Added Number type contentWidth,Height properties.
Changed the layout property type and implementation.  The type is now
Object (was Class) to allow one to specify one of the predefined
layout class names, or a layout instance.
named using the (string class name valued) layout attribute.
Changed the type of the layout property to Object to match the
Replaced private static GAP:int constant with a similar "gap"
property.  Gap is the vertical space between rows, default is 6.
Added a rowCount:int property and a protected explicitRowCount var.
The rowCount property specifies the number of visible rows, which
implies the layoutTarget's height.  The default is -1 which means
that all rows should be visible.
Added rowHeight:Number and colWidth:Number properties, along with
their protected explicitFoo counterparts.  Currently unused.
Changed the measure function: if rowCount wasn't explicitly set
to -1, then the layoutTarget's height is the height of the first
rowCount items (plus the gap).  The layoutTarget's contentHeight
is set to the items' total height.
Changed the updateDisplayList function to set the scrollRect
